Based on my search results, I can provide you with information about Pride and Prejudice's presence on TikTok, BookTok, and social media memes in 2024. Here's what I found:

## Pride and Prejudice on TikTok and BookTok in 2024

### BookTok Community and Trends
TikTok's trend "BookTok" where creators can share their favorite books affects their viewers. Recently, "BookTok" has emerged as a vibrant trend on TikTok that captivates a diverse enviornment of readers.(no content)With over 181.7 billion viewers and 28.6M hashtag views, BookTok proudly stands among the platform's top ranking content categories.(no content)Anyone can share their favorite recommendations by reviewing and discussing books or creating engaging content like memes, merchandise and ASMR videos.(no content)BookTok is a hashtag used by creators who feature book recommendations, reviews and memes.

### Pride and Prejudice's Viral Presence
As usual, Gen Z has found creative and fun ways to include the classic in popular media. We know everyone has the "sides" of TikTok they're on, and Pride and Prejudice TikTok is one you definitely need on your For You page.(no content)TikTok bookworms and fans of the movie adaptations have started making Pride and Prejudice POVs, art, memes and just generally aesthetically pleasing TikToks romanticizing the fantastic world and ideals of the story.

### Mr. Darcy Hand Flex Viral Moment
One of the most significant viral moments was the Mr. Darcy hand flex scene from the 2005 film adaptation. Following the video, a whole side of TikTok was talking about Mr. Darcy's hand flex left and right – so much the topic itself on the platform has nearly 10 million views.(no content)It's a movie that went viral this past year thanks to TikTok.

### Social Media Adaptations and Memes
There's even been a book adaptation of the concept: When authors Claire McGowan and Sarah Day imagined how 'Pride and Prejudice on Social Media' might look, retelling the story through mocked-up social media posts, their post instantly went viral.

### Netflix Adaptation Buzz
A "Pride and Prejudice" series is apparently in the works at Netflix and fans are already throwing out names for the role of Mr. Darcy. "I saw someone on TikTok that recommended Dev Patel play Mr. Darcy in the Netflix Pride and Prejudice adaptation, and that has lived rent free in my head since I heard it," a fan shared on Threads.

### BookTok's Overall Impact in 2024
TikTok's book community has been responsible for millions of dollars of book sales. In the past four years, BookTok, has gone from a scrappy, grassroots group that makes literature-centered content into a major and uncontrollable marketing driver of the publishing industry. BookTok has been personally responsible for millions of dollars of book sales and made authors household names in the process.

The search results show that Pride and Prejudice maintains a strong presence on TikTok through BookTok content, memes, edits, and viral moments, particularly around Mr. Darcy content and anticipation for the upcoming Netflix adaptation.
